step2.heading: Chapter 2 - The Story
step2.intro: You can create your story by drawing it, recording it, or simply writing it down.
step2.textPlaceholder: Once upon a time... Let your imagination run wild! Share your adventure, your dreams, or any story that's close to your heart.
step2.textHelp: Write as much or as little as you'd like. You can always edit this later!
step2.imageHelp: Draw your story, take a photo of it, or upload an existing image that tells your tale.
step2.audioHelp: Record your story directly or upload an audio file. Perfect for those who prefer to speak their tales!
step2.recordingHelp: Tell your story! Speak clearly into your microphone.
step2.reassurance: If you've written text or uploaded an image above, our Oompa-Loompas will work hard to extract characters, settings, and themes. Otherwise, the next steps will guide you through creating your story step by step.

writingTips.text: Where does your story take place? Describe the world - is it a magical kingdom, a cozy town, or somewhere beyond imagination?
Who are the main characters? What makes them special or unique? What are their dreams and fears?
Outline the basic plot for your story.
Just write what is in your heart.
Write about a child memory or upcoming event!
What do your characters want to achieve? Give them a clear goal to work towards.
What makes your story unique? Add special elements that only exist in your world!

photoTips.title: üì∏ Photo Tips
tips: Take photos of drawings, scenes, or written notes
You can add up to 3 images to tell your story
Our AI will analyze images to help create your story
Mix photos with text or audio for a richer story

recordingTips.title: Recording Tips
tips: Speak clearly and at a comfortable pace
Describe your story as if telling it to a friend
Include details about characters, settings, and events
Don't worry about being perfect - just tell your story!

literaryPersona.label: Narrator Persona
literaryPersona.helper: We default to our balanced classic narrator. Pick another vibe if you want a different voice.

metaInfo.title: How to read these badges
metaInfo.description: POV, Tone, Rhythm, and Vocab describe how the narrator speaks. Use them to pick the voice that fits your scene.

pov.label: POV (Point of View)
pov.description: Who is telling the story. 1st = I, 2nd = you, 3rd-limited = one character's eyes, 3rd-omniscient = everyone.

tone.label: Tone
tone.description: Emotional energy from calm (1) to intense (5).

rhythm.label: Rhythm
rhythm.description: Sentence pacing from slow/flowing (1) to quick/punchy (5).

vocabulary.label: Vocabulary
vocabulary.description: Word complexity from simple, everyday words (1) to richer, more advanced language (5).

storyteller.name: The Storyteller
storyteller.description: Warm, empathetic voice like a grandparent sharing memories; feelings-forward with gentle morals.
storyteller.sample: On a windy Sunday by the ocean in northern Portugal, Rodrigo set the ball down for John and spoke softly until his little brother breathed easier and tried again.

adventurous-narrator.name: The Adventurous Narrator
adventurous-narrator.description: Turns ordinary moments epic with playful second-person energy and fantasy flourishes.
adventurous-narrator.sample: You hop onto the tiny coastal pitch, Rodrigo hands you the ball like a quest item, and John dashes after it while the Atlantic wind cheers like a stadium crowd.

fun-reporter.name: The Fun Reporter
fun-reporter.description: Upbeat, witty chronicle of group antics with quick beats and quotes.
fun-reporter.sample: 16:42 - Small field by the ocean, north Portugal. Rodrigo (coach/brother) cues John: "tiny touches." 16:45 - Ball escapes to the sea breeze. 16:50 - John reels it back. Quote: "It's fighting the wind!"

friendly-educator.name: The Friendly Educator
friendly-educator.description: Gentle, clear teacher voice that uses simple questions and examples.
friendly-educator.sample: Let's learn on that breezy Sunday field by the ocean: Rodrigo shows John a soft touch, asks him to look up, and turns each retry into a small win.

institutional-chronicler.name: The Institutional Chronicler
institutional-chronicler.description: Formal, precise biographical tone that keeps details factual and organized.
institutional-chronicler.sample: On Sunday afternoon, Rodrigo conducted basic ball-control drills for his younger brother John on a small coastal field in northern Portugal; repetitions improved John's close control despite steady wind.

pub-buddy-narrator.name: The Pub Buddy Narrator
pub-buddy-narrator.description: Ultra-casual, jokey storytelling like a friend recounting the night over drinks.
pub-buddy-narrator.sample: Dude, Sunday by the sea, tiny pitch, wind going nuts. Rodrigo drops the ball, John taps it, the thing bolts for the ocean. We're yelling, laughing, and somehow the kid nails the next try.

classic-novelist.name: The Classic Novelist
classic-novelist.description: Balanced, immersive voice that shows not tells, fitting most stories without extremes.
classic-novelist.sample: On a small football field by the ocean in northern Portugal, Rodrigo set the ball at John's feet and waited until his brother's shoulders loosened; the wind seemed to pause with them until the next gentle touch.

noir-investigator.name: The Noir Investigator
noir-investigator.description: Gritty, suspicious, and atmospheric, like a hardboiled detective piecing clues together.
noir-investigator.sample: Sunday, north coast. Rodrigo runs drills on a wind-bitten field, teaching John to keep the ball close. Ocean murmurs, ball slips, kid frowns. Feels like there's a lesson hidden in the salt air.

whimsical-poet.name: The Whimsical Poet
whimsical-poet.description: Lyrical, romantic, and image-rich, turning simple scenes into tender moments.
whimsical-poet.sample: The field, a ribbon between grass and sea, held Rodrigo and little John on a Sunday afternoon; each soft tap of the ball was a tide returning, each smile a small light on the north coast.

scifi-analyst.name: The Sci-Fi Analyst
scifi-analyst.description: Precise, futuristic voice that treats life like a mission log with a wink of dry humor.
scifi-analyst.sample: LOG 04 // Coastal field, North Portugal // Instructor Rodrigo initiates Ball Control Protocols for junior unit John. Environment: high wind, ocean noise. Outcome: control radius improves after repeated iterations.

folklore-traditionalist.name: The Folklore Traditionalist
folklore-traditionalist.description: Timeless, fable-like voice that speaks in symbols, omens, and gentle morals.
folklore-traditionalist.sample: And so, on a Sunday by the northern sea, Rodrigo the elder set the ball before John, the younger. The wind tested them, yet patience returned as the tide, until the child's touch grew sure.
